column4: hey, is anyone here comfortable troubleshooting an nvidia driver install issue?
did you install the ubuntu packages?  did you follow the wiki page?
I did follow the wiki page, and I would like to say yes to having installed the ubuntu packages, but I'm not sure.
as long as you didn't use a download from nvidia.com
right, I didn't, I used synaptic. When I try to run the -config enable, I get an error.
what's the error?
want me to paste the error, or give the shorthand?
pastebin please
dbmata@stigmata:~$ sudo nvidia-glx-config disable
?? that I don't know... I definitely didn't want what happened though.
okay, well that's fairly self-explanatory.  Go ahead and change nv to nvidia manually
next time use pastebin please ;)
just got the link to a pastebin page. Never heard of it before, sorry.
no problem
since I'm not sure how to actually manually edit anything, is there a walk through in the wiki?
sudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf
what do you know. Thank you. Sorry for the flooding. (I haven't been this confused by an os since my first jump into DOS back in the day.)
you'll learn.  In fact, it's easier than windows, so you'll have no troubles.  :)
I like it much better than my failed attempt at debian a couple years back.
glad to hear that :)
I just did that edit, and I'm getting the same error. Thoughts? (It still says I need to change "Driver" from nv to nvidia.)
think I should remove and reinstall the driver package?
no.  If you edit it by hand, you don't re-run the script
oh, ok. now I'm confused.
